comments.body: yes plz great idea
great idea

Currently, the only vanilla way to do that is by placing blocks on a large, flat area that corresponds to the smallest map size and making a map of it.  That's a LOT of work and not really feasible in survival, so I like your idea!  That's a lot less work than filling an entire map.

They could also create an easel to do the painting.  Colored dyes already exist, and they could give the brush a second use as a paintbrush.
I'd be interested to see this implemented with the new archaeology features.
I don't think that's what Minecraft is for
plz do

on 1 hand it would be cool 

on the other it seems useless

What would rubies be used for? I think that any new ore should have a unique purpose beyond just looking cool. Look at the existing ores:

  • Coal: major fuel source, and used to craft one of the most important blocks in the game: the torch
  • Iron: mid-game equipment tier; major crafting ingredient for technical blocks like pistons, hoppers, rails, etc.
  • Gold: Piglin currency, fastest and most enchantable tools, powered rails, golden apples/carrots, bells, and clocks (that last one is kind of useless, though)
  • Diamond: late-game equipment tier, enchanting table, jukebox
  • Lapis: enchanting, dye
  • Redstone: self-explanatory
  • Quartz: advanced redstone components, fancy family of building blocks, used to craft andesite/diorite/granite on old pre-1.8 worlds with limited access to those blocks
  • Emerald: villager currency

Technically, rubies are already in the game. They're just green and called emeralds. To quote Minecraft developer Dinnerbone:

"We actually didn't go with rubies and changed to emeralds at last minute for the villager trading because I'm colour blind and couldn't easily spot the difference between the ruby ore and redstone ore until I was up close"

It's kind of redundant to have two red ores in the game, isn't it? But then again, perhaps rubies could be introduced as pink/magenta rather than red.

Lanterns, lecterns, and crying obsidian were all added in a way that brought something new and useful to the game. So before you can add rubies, you have to come up with a reason for them to exist.

I've always wanted a grapple ever since the crossbow was added. Having grapples would make it easier and it would be so much fun to mine and explore the ravines!
It now costs 3 dye (if starting with white wool) to create a colored bed. Do maybe you would have to shift-right-click with at least 3 dye in hand and the cost would be 3 dye.

I tried this in 1.16.4 and it doesn't seem to work, I also can't change the color of the bed by putting the bed in a 2x2 or 3x3 crafting grid with a dye. I made a white bed into a red with one red dye instead of 3 Red Wool but I could not change the Red Bed into a Yellow Bed by using one yellow dye maybe I am misremembering this but that's it used to work as far as I can remember.

Edit: Just check it in 1.12.2 and same thing, maybe perhaps you can only change the color of white beds and not colored beds. Somebody tell me if they have had a similar issue or know of another post detailing a similar problem.
